flow.descriptionCdata:
46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.0144ac6a-5f72-4bf0-b271-2f312edacf17.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.05f218ba-521b-4b1c-9d12-9662cf2bfe89.description=\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#Additional Parameters\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\# This operation gets the cookbook recipes Inputs\: cookbookName - The cookbook name. cookbookVersion - The cookbook version. responseTimeOut - Time out for the operation, populates the OOB timeout variable. apiHostName - The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife). apiHostUser - A user name with sufficient rights to run the knife commands. apiHostPassword - The apiHostUser's password. apiHostRepo - The path to the chef repository (The chef-repo folder). outputFormat - The format of the result. You can use json\text\yaml\pp \#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#Original Description\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\# 
Uses WMI to attempt to create a remote process on a machine.  The command passed should be formatted as though it was run on the command line.

CAUTION\: internally 'cmd /c' gets prepended to the command passed.  Also '2>tempfile 1>tempfile' get appended to the command so that we can attempt to capture stdout and stderr.
So your command will look like this when executed\:
	'cmd /c [yourcommand] 2>temperr 1>tempout'

Inputs\:
    host - Hostname or ip address of the target machine.
    command - The command you want executed. Special characters\: <, >, (, ), & need to be escaped using the caret (^) character.  The only exception to this rule is when the > character is used to redirect output.
    user - Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank).
    password - Password of the user.
    outputPath - Network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default the path will have to be changed on Windows 2000 systems.
    currentDirectory - Current directory.
    characterSet - The character encoding used to write the batch file that will be remotely executed by the operation. Unicode character encodings may not supported for this input (utf-8, utf-16, etc.).  Support for unicode encodings depends on target system capabilities.  By default this encoding will also be used to read the command output that is redirected to temporary files.  If the command output is expected to be of different encoding, specify the different encoding in the outputCharacterSet input.  Default value\: The encoding of the operating system where is RAS installed.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis
    outputCharacterSet - The character encoding used to read the command output that was redirected to temporary files.  Only need to specify this input if the output of the command is known to output a different character encoding.  As an example\: the 'wmic' command returns utf-16 encoded output.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis, utf-8, utf-16
    timeout - The number of seconds before assuming the remote process is no longer functional. After the timeout has expired the remote process and all child processes will be terminated.
Default value\: 90

Responses\:
    success - Remote process successfully launched and has completed executing.
    failure - Unable to start remote process.

Results\:
    returnResult - Return value from WMI for starting the process (not the exit value of the process).
    processID - The process id of the remote process.
    processReturnCode - The return code of the remote process.
    stdOut - Standard output from the remote process.
    stdErr - Standard error from the remote process.

Notes\: 
List of possible encoding names (Support for the encoding may depend on the version or language of the RAS OS)\:

Encoding Name\:	Description\:
IBM437		OEM United States
DOS-720		Arabic (DOS)
ibm737		Greek (DOS)
ibm775		Baltic (DOS)
ibm850		Western European (DOS)
ibm852		Central European (DOS)
IBM855		OEM Cyrillic
ibm857		Turkish (DOS)
IBM00858		OEM Multilingual Latin I
IBM860		Portuguese (DOS)
ibm861		Icelandic (DOS)
DOS-862		Hebrew (DOS)
IBM863		French Canadian (DOS)
IBM864		Arabic (864)
IBM865		Nordic (DOS)
cp866		Cyrillic (DOS)
ibm869		Greek, Modern (DOS)
shift_jis		Japanese (Shift-JIS)
gb2312		Chinese Simplified (GB2312)
ks_c_5601-1987	Korean
big5		Chinese Traditional (Big5)
utf-16		Unicode
unicodeFFFE		Unicode (Big-Endian)
utf-7		Unicode (UTF-7)
utf-8		Unicode (UTF-8)
utf-32		Unicode (UTF-32)
utf-32BE		Unicode (UTF-32 Big-Endian)
Johab		Korean (Johab)
us-ascii		US-ASCII
koi8-r		Cyrillic (KOI8-R)
euc-jp		Japanese (EUC)
EUC-CN		Chinese Simplified (EUC)
euc-kr		Korean (EUC)
hz-gb-2312		Chinese Simplified (HZ)
GB18030		Chinese Simplified (GB18030)
46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.085cdf8c-52cf-4cd1-9bf5-e8c94b64b703.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.2207da21-f651-407b-8aa8-eadd4041effe.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.0c720ea0-6198-4fdb-a88f-5c2622d8ce9b.callout=This flow adds a recipe to a node, in a specified order in the node's run list. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.179d6e0c-0872-4a54-9021-15ee3e857748.prompt=The time out for the operations (in seconds). 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.1c45cc18-c2c8-491c-9c41-d1b8cb52fda5.prompt=Time out (in seconds) for the operations. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.1d12c919-16c2-46c1-8332-3457c0563b3b.prompt=Select the recipe to deploy. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.1faf3bbf-ec2e-4a5a-a200-d25a53e98ff4.prompt=The apiHostUser's password. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.2bbec8f0-c481-4204-ac83-9cf968836a1f.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.358dd4db-f112-4ca5-8dbb-15672ca5fd30.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.ba42f7f4-6b68-4344-88ec-8ff8d5d01601.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.53324183-711d-4089-9a62-5f2db9f793cb.callout=In case the default recipe should be added, the cookbook's name should be used as the run list item 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.571d8c97-dd64-4240-949a-e47f3d243ea6.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.0b9a43f9-ef57-4de9-81f9-d16e9fbbc1d5.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.593647af-1a0f-4cae-9e57-4e07700030ac.prompt=The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife). 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.5b967239-bde5-4c5c-864c-fa5e9a3301c8.description=\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#Additional Parameters\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\# This operation gets the node details. Inputs\: nodeName - The node name. responseTimeOut - Time out for the operation, populates the OOB timeout variable. apiHostName - The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife). apiHostUser - A user name with sufficient rights to run the knife commands. apiHostPassword - The apiHostUser's password. apiHostRepo - The path to the chef repository (The chef-repo folder). outputFormat - The format of the result. You can use json\text\yaml\pp \#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#Original Description\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\# 
Uses WMI to attempt to create a remote process on a machine.  The command passed should be formatted as though it was run on the command line.

CAUTION\: internally 'cmd /c' gets prepended to the command passed.  Also '2>tempfile 1>tempfile' get appended to the command so that we can attempt to capture stdout and stderr.
So your command will look like this when executed\:
	'cmd /c [yourcommand] 2>temperr 1>tempout'

Inputs\:
    host - Hostname or ip address of the target machine.
    command - The command you want executed. Special characters\: <, >, (, ), & need to be escaped using the caret (^) character.  The only exception to this rule is when the > character is used to redirect output.
    user - Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank).
    password - Password of the user.
    outputPath - Network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default the path will have to be changed on Windows 2000 systems.
    currentDirectory - Current directory.
    characterSet - The character encoding used to write the batch file that will be remotely executed by the operation. Unicode character encodings may not supported for this input (utf-8, utf-16, etc.).  Support for unicode encodings depends on target system capabilities.  By default this encoding will also be used to read the command output that is redirected to temporary files.  If the command output is expected to be of different encoding, specify the different encoding in the outputCharacterSet input.  Default value\: The encoding of the operating system where is RAS installed.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis
    outputCharacterSet - The character encoding used to read the command output that was redirected to temporary files.  Only need to specify this input if the output of the command is known to output a different character encoding.  As an example\: the 'wmic' command returns utf-16 encoded output.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis, utf-8, utf-16
    timeout - The number of seconds before assuming the remote process is no longer functional. After the timeout has expired the remote process and all child processes will be terminated.
Default value\: 90

Responses\:
    success - Remote process successfully launched and has completed executing.
    failure - Unable to start remote process.

Results\:
    returnResult - Return value from WMI for starting the process (not the exit value of the process).
    processID - The process id of the remote process.
    processReturnCode - The return code of the remote process.
    stdOut - Standard output from the remote process.
    stdErr - Standard error from the remote process.

Notes\: 
List of possible encoding names (Support for the encoding may depend on the version or language of the RAS OS)\:

Encoding Name\:	Description\:
IBM437		OEM United States
DOS-720		Arabic (DOS)
ibm737		Greek (DOS)
ibm775		Baltic (DOS)
ibm850		Western European (DOS)
ibm852		Central European (DOS)
IBM855		OEM Cyrillic
ibm857		Turkish (DOS)
IBM00858		OEM Multilingual Latin I
IBM860		Portuguese (DOS)
ibm861		Icelandic (DOS)
DOS-862		Hebrew (DOS)
IBM863		French Canadian (DOS)
IBM864		Arabic (864)
IBM865		Nordic (DOS)
cp866		Cyrillic (DOS)
ibm869		Greek, Modern (DOS)
shift_jis		Japanese (Shift-JIS)
gb2312		Chinese Simplified (GB2312)
ks_c_5601-1987	Korean
big5		Chinese Traditional (Big5)
utf-16		Unicode
unicodeFFFE		Unicode (Big-Endian)
utf-7		Unicode (UTF-7)
utf-8		Unicode (UTF-8)
utf-32		Unicode (UTF-32)
utf-32BE		Unicode (UTF-32 Big-Endian)
Johab		Korean (Johab)
us-ascii		US-ASCII
koi8-r		Cyrillic (KOI8-R)
euc-jp		Japanese (EUC)
EUC-CN		Chinese Simplified (EUC)
euc-kr		Korean (EUC)
hz-gb-2312		Chinese Simplified (HZ)
GB18030		Chinese Simplified (GB18030)
46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.5fb19d3b-6b82-4b55-94b3-feff37319371.callout=Select node and get run list items 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.63e6950a-6057-4d06-9afc-83f9aeebdb8b.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.8e7dc77c-28b0-4e43-8412-be0bc5be265d.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.69a7fdad-683f-44a6-96b2-17f6c9fd84f5.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.4bfe0023-d829-49a4-93f6-65665e6cc0f8.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.6b7f86d0-f4f7-4217-b368-b7d7542f01fe.prompt=The apiHostUser's password. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.6c55cc86-de94-4fe0-8831-a5f9fb0d463b.description=\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#Additional Parameters\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\# This operation lists the nodes. Inputs\: responseTimeOut - Time out for the operation, populates the OOB timeout variable. apiHostName - The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife). apiHostUser - A user name with sufficient rights to run the knife commands. apiHostPassword - The apiHostUser's password. apiHostRepo - The path to the chef repository (The chef-repo folder). Outputs\: nodeList - The list of nodes, seperated by a "|" \#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#Original Description\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\# 
Uses WMI to attempt to create a remote process on a machine.  The command passed should be formatted as though it was run on the command line.

CAUTION\: internally 'cmd /c' gets prepended to the command passed.  Also '2>tempfile 1>tempfile' get appended to the command so that we can attempt to capture stdout and stderr.
So your command will look like this when executed\:
	'cmd /c [yourcommand] 2>temperr 1>tempout'

Inputs\:
    host - Hostname or ip address of the target machine.
    command - The command you want executed. Special characters\: <, >, (, ), & need to be escaped using the caret (^) character.  The only exception to this rule is when the > character is used to redirect output.
    user - Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank).
    password - Password of the user.
    outputPath - Network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default the path will have to be changed on Windows 2000 systems.
    currentDirectory - Current directory.
    characterSet - The character encoding used to write the batch file that will be remotely executed by the operation. Unicode character encodings may not supported for this input (utf-8, utf-16, etc.).  Support for unicode encodings depends on target system capabilities.  By default this encoding will also be used to read the command output that is redirected to temporary files.  If the command output is expected to be of different encoding, specify the different encoding in the outputCharacterSet input.  Default value\: The encoding of the operating system where is RAS installed.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis
    outputCharacterSet - The character encoding used to read the command output that was redirected to temporary files.  Only need to specify this input if the output of the command is known to output a different character encoding.  As an example\: the 'wmic' command returns utf-16 encoded output.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis, utf-8, utf-16
    timeout - The number of seconds before assuming the remote process is no longer functional. After the timeout has expired the remote process and all child processes will be terminated.
Default value\: 90

Responses\:
    success - Remote process successfully launched and has completed executing.
    failure - Unable to start remote process.

Results\:
    returnResult - Return value from WMI for starting the process (not the exit value of the process).
    processID - The process id of the remote process.
    processReturnCode - The return code of the remote process.
    stdOut - Standard output from the remote process.
    stdErr - Standard error from the remote process.

Notes\: 
List of possible encoding names (Support for the encoding may depend on the version or language of the RAS OS)\:

Encoding Name\:	Description\:
IBM437		OEM United States
DOS-720		Arabic (DOS)
ibm737		Greek (DOS)

shift_jis		Japanese (Shift-JIS)

46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.6de0a8d7-26a0-466f-b19e-708423ba0b0a.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.65a67183-3546-49b1-ae22-d7c4db121335.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.86ad1dc2-7b95-47c1-9d6f-a45c300c7b3a.prompt=Time out for the operation, populates the OOB timeout variable. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.886dab40-fe3e-4229-b113-6ef6358a733d.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.901e1ad1-b479-4a87-a2c8-2d56b60eb572.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.8d516289-e35d-4388-a050-78fe870e272a.prompt=The path to the Chef repository (The chef-repo folder). 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.a3382258-5dbc-4fd9-96d1-0b5a62cf5eda.prompt=The apiHostUser's password. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.a78f4124-8304-4481-bdfd-a45441e7019a.callout=Select recipe and set insert order 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.ab7df1dd-956b-4df8-93be-12c5353e4ce1.prompt=A user name with sufficient rights to run the knife commands. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.b0ca0d9a-54b1-49f5-8cbd-81ab8d86d748.prompt=A user name with sufficient rights to run the knife commands. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.b2718927-23c7-43f2-b2ed-78162d24dfb6.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.df68b015-b295-4c75-8034-5817126f1130.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.b98b920a-84a4-45c3-911f-791d13798de4.prompt=Time out for the operation, populates the OOB timeout variable. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.bc877da5-d2c1-4451-843a-a8933f2ee945.prompt=The path to the chef repository (The chef-repo folder). 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.bea5bb83-3dc6-49e8-b43a-8640d8b535c5.description=\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#Additional Parameters\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\# This operations adds recepies and\or roles to a node. Inputs\: runlistItem - The run recepie or role which you want to add. nodeName - The node name. responseTimeOut - Time out for the operation, populates the OOB timeout variable. apiHostName - The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife). apiHostUser - A user name with sufficient rights to run the knife commands. apiHostPassword - The apiHostUser's password. apiHostRepo - The path to the chef repository (The chef-repo folder). Notes\: The runlistItem input can be used in the following formats\: - To add the default recipe of a cookbook, use the cookbook name. - To add a specific recipe from a cookbook , use one of the following\: FQDN Format\: recipe[COOKBOOK\:\:RECIPE_NAME]. Cookbook format\: COOKBOOK\:\:RECIPE_NAME. - To add a role use role[ROLE_NAME]. -To add several items, use a comma seperator. e.g \:recipe[COOKBOOK\:\:RECIPE_NAME],COOKBOOK\:\:RECIPE_NAME,role[ROLE_NAME]. -To add an item before an existing item use -b 'EXISTING ITEM NAME'. -To add an item after an existing item use -a 'EXISTING ITEM NAME'. \#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#Original Description\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\#\# 
Uses WMI to attempt to create a remote process on a machine.  The command passed should be formatted as though it was run on the command line.

CAUTION\: internally 'cmd /c' gets prepended to the command passed.  Also '2>tempfile 1>tempfile' get appended to the command so that we can attempt to capture stdout and stderr.
So your command will look like this when executed\:
	'cmd /c [yourcommand] 2>temperr 1>tempout'

Inputs\:
    host - Hostname or ip address of the target machine.
    command - The command you want executed. Special characters\: <, >, (, ), & need to be escaped using the caret (^) character.  The only exception to this rule is when the > character is used to redirect output.
    user - Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank).
    password - Password of the user.
    outputPath - Network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default the path will have to be changed on Windows 2000 systems.
    currentDirectory - Current directory.
    characterSet - The character encoding used to write the batch file that will be remotely executed by the operation. Unicode character encodings may not supported for this input (utf-8, utf-16, etc.).  Support for unicode encodings depends on target system capabilities.  By default this encoding will also be used to read the command output that is redirected to temporary files.  If the command output is expected to be of different encoding, specify the different encoding in the outputCharacterSet input.  Default value\: The encoding of the operating system where is RAS installed.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis
    outputCharacterSet - The character encoding used to read the command output that was redirected to temporary files.  Only need to specify this input if the output of the command is known to output a different character encoding.  As an example\: the 'wmic' command returns utf-16 encoded output.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis, utf-8, utf-16
    timeout - The number of seconds before assuming the remote process is no longer functional. After the timeout has expired the remote process and all child processes will be terminated.
Default value\: 90

Responses\:
    success - Remote process successfully launched and has completed executing.
    failure - Unable to start remote process.

Results\:
    returnResult - Return value from WMI for starting the process (not the exit value of the process).
    processID - The process id of the remote process.
    processReturnCode - The return code of the remote process.
    stdOut - Standard output from the remote process.
    stdErr - Standard error from the remote process.

Notes\: 
List of possible encoding names (Support for the encoding may depend on the version or language of the RAS OS)\:

Encoding Name\:	Description\:
IBM437		OEM United States
DOS-720		Arabic (DOS)

ibm852		Central European (DOS)

utf-32BE		Unicode (UTF-32 Big-Endian)
Johab		Korean (Johab)
us-ascii		US-ASCII
koi8-r		Cyrillic (KOI8-R)
euc-jp		Japanese (EUC)
EUC-CN		Chinese Simplified (EUC)
euc-kr		Korean (EUC)
hz-gb-2312		Chinese Simplified (HZ)
GB18030		Chinese Simplified (GB18030)
46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.c74d8272-cf44-4879-8c37-0ef817773354.prompt=The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife). 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.c9e010f9-c566-4ad9-89ec-ca0d4afe3a1c.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.cc86b1c9-f670-46f3-b32f-e7579202dd9b.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.9b6b8c95-7280-41c6-93be-330aa6df5efb.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.ce00535b-3f64-4042-ad58-73d3bb4691e8.callout=Add recipe to node 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.ce496686-8029-4c2b-a09b-fbbaaa4dc60c.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.8572dae3-9907-4dd9-ac20-5b732d8467ef.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.cfdec7e7-9d3b-462b-a833-b950f41bf69e.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.5c5b3194-fd3a-4cf5-aad2-45015c538b90.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.d46401ce-fa18-40d9-96ac-12d0117e7820.prompt=A Chef server user name with sufficient rights 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.dc2b66b2-941b-409b-92ac-dbacd30291a7.prompt=3b41df09-dcb7-462e-956f-ac053ffb8dc5.e2da50e0-c344-4024-9231-7a4d8e1586b6.prompt 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.description=
This flow creates a role json file and uses it to create the role for a specific environment.


Inputs\:
responseTimeOut - Time out (in seconds) for the operations.
apiHostName - The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife).
apiHostUser - A user name with sufficient rights to run the knife commands.
apiHostPassword - The apiHostUser's password.
apiHostRepo - The path to the chef repository (The chef-repo folder).
46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.dff77e84-5895-4a55-b1ff-e51ba20d5c8a.description=This operation lists the deployed cookbooks Inputs\: responseTimeOut - Time out for the operation, populates the OOB timeout variable. apiHostName - The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife). apiHostUser - A user name with sufficient rights to run the knife commands. apiHostPassword - The apiHostUser's password. apiHostRepo - The path to the chef repository (The chef-repo folder). Outputs\: cookbooks - the list of cookbooks. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.e117efc9-6280-4bda-a4cb-4ef60c5a2e38.prompt=The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife). 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.e1983241-48b9-43a0-96de-d4ba75ec3782.prompt=The path to the chef repository (The chef-repo folder). 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.e433bfa4-bf0e-4236-948f-47ee3e192bc6.prompt=apiHostUser's password 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.e60b9ef6-ebc7-47b4-93ba-3c039ec7a2a6.prompt=The path to the chef repository (The chef-repo folder). 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.ee0d5907-330c-4db0-a0c8-895bfebe516e.prompt=The node name. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.f81d51a4-93f5-479e-bd55-c68b4fae8c56.prompt=The name/fqdn of a host which runs Chefs APi client (knife). 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.fb5934a2-8229-4c43-95ec-d52c620e202b.prompt=A user name with sufficient rights to run the knife commands. 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.ff7cf146-ce5d-46aa-82b1-ac8335e90cf3.callout=Select cookbook and list it's recipes 46ebaff0-0811-4579-9376-34e077de16ce.ffa06bdc-b833-44e1-b6d3-417e48a6d0d6.prompt=The time out for the operations (in seconds).
flow.name: Add Recipe to Node in a specific order
